revised_title: Argon-Oxygen Liquid-Vapor Equilibrium: A Comprehensive Study
tldr: This study investigates the liquid-vapor equilibrium of the argon/oxygen binary system, measuring the vapor pressures of condensed liquid mixtures and determining the composition differences between liquid and vapor phases in equilibrium. The results show a marked positive deviation from ideal behavior, with a tendency to form a low-boiling azeotrope. The data is presented in tabular form, and constants and formulas are provided for calculating values for any pressure, temperature, or composition.
